uc:usecase.uc:name: Consumer Registration
uc:usecase.uc:goal: Consumer has been registered to the m-Wallet.
uc:usecase.uc:description:
Consumer has been registered to the m-Wallet.
foo
bar
uc:usecase.uc:stakeholder: Service Provider wants to get all relevant data of the consumer.
Consumer wants to be able to top-up his registered account and to use his account to purchase things.
Merchant wants to provide the consumer to register easily to a payment system, that he will be able to buy goods easily.

uc:guarantees.uc:success: Consumer is registered to the system. All relevant consumer data are stored.
uc:guarantees.uc:minimal: Consumer gets knowledge about the failure of the registration and the reason about it.

uc:success.uc:step: System sends initial formular asking for the MSISDN of the Consumer.
Consumer enters "human-only-readable" letters from a picture (e.g. Human Interactive Proof-Technologie).
System checks entered human interaction proof text.
System checks for an account already existing.
System generates registration code. Dummy reference to other use case step
System sends SMS containing registration code to MSISDN.
Consumer enters registration code and submits form. (Requirement: )

System asks for consumer personal data.
first name
last name
password
confirmation of the terms and conditions.
After filling out the form the consumer submits.
System creates account with all the data given.
Consumer will be asked about to configure a payment instrument.

uc:extension.name: MSISDN_MALFORMED
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies an error to the Consumer, that the MSISDN was malformed.

uc:extension.name: MSISDN_ALREADY_IN_USE
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies an error to the Consumer, that the MSISDN is already in use with an account.

uc:extension.name: HUMAN_INTERACTION_NOT_PROOFED
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies an error to the Consumer, that the text for human interaction proof was not entered correctly.
Back to registration formular. The Human Interaction Proof will be changed.

uc:extension.name: SMS_SEND FAILS
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies an error to the Consumer, that the sending of the SMS failed and informs about the reason of the failure, if available.
Back to registration formular. The Human Interaction Proof will be changed.

uc:extension.name: WRONG_REGISTRATION_CODE
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies to the Consumer, that the registration code he entered was wrong.

uc:extension.name: INCORRECT_PERSONAL_DATA
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies to consumer, which personal data fields were not filled correctly.

uc:extension.name: FAILED_ACCOUNT_CREATION
uc:extension.uc:step: System replies to the Consumer, that the creation of his account failed giving the reason if available.

uc:usecase.uc:test-annotations: This is an example for testing
uc:usecase.uc:open_issue: After entering a wrong registration code, is it okay to start from entering the MSISDN on or should there be a retry mechanism starting from UC-10-8 or UC-10-10 directly?
Should the consumer personal data formular be extracted into another use case?
What are the exact checks in ? Should they be detailed here.
To avoid usage of human interaction proof, it is a better way that consumern sends SMS to the wallet, to register his MSISDN?
